channel.title: cheatsheet on Vinod Kurup
channel.description: Recent content in cheatsheet on Vinod Kurup

item.title: Deleting old snaps
item.author: vinod@kurup.com (Vinod Kurup, MD)
item.description: Copy this script into ~/bin/: #!/bin/bash # Removes old revisions of snaps # CLOSE ALL SNAPS BEFORE RUNNING THIS set -ex LANG=en_US.UTF-8 snap list --all | awk '/disabled/{print $1, $3}' | while read snapname revision; do sudo snap remove "$snapname" --revision="$revision" done Found on https://www.linuxuprising.com/2019/04/how-to-remove-old-snap-versions-to-free.html and slightly edited.
